problem:
\begin{problem*}{}{}
  Let $a$, $b$, $c$ be positive real numbers such that
  $abc=1$. Prove that,
  \[
    \left( a-1+\frac{1}{b} \right)
    \left( b-1+\frac{1}{c} \right) \left( c-1+
    \frac{1}{a}\right) \le 1
  .\]
\end{problem*}
solution:
\begin{soln}
  Substitute $a=\frac{y}{z}$, $b=\frac{z}{x}$, $c= \frac{x}{y}$.

  Then we have to prove that,
  \[
    (x+y-z)(y+z-x)(z+x-y)\le xyz
  .\]
  
  WLOG assume $x = \max\left\{ x,y,z \right\}$. Then note that
  $(x+y-z)$ and $(z+x-y)$ are both positive. If $(y+z-x)$ is
  negative, we are clearly done.

  Otherwise, $(y+z-x)$ is also positive. Then $x$, $y$, $z$ 
  are sides of a triangle. Let $p=x+y-z$, $q=y+z-x$, $r=z+x-y$.

  Then note that the inequality that we have to prove changes
  to,
  \[
    \left( \frac{p+q}{2} \right) \left( \frac{q+r}{2} \right)
    \left( \frac{r+p}{2} \right) \ge pqr
  \]
  which is indeed true using AM-GM. Equality holds if $a=b=c=1$.
\end{soln}
